title: Garratt
summary: A Garratt (often referred to as a Beyer Garratt) is a type of steam locomotive invented by British engineer Herbert William Garratt that is articulated into three parts.[1] Its boiler, firebox, and cab are mounted on a centre frame or "bridge". The two other parts, one at each end, have a pivot to support the central frame; they consist of a steam engine unit â€“ with driving wheels, trailing wheels, valve gear, and cylinders, and above it, fuel and/or water storage.
